subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Strong Is Beautiful Movement
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Strong Is Beautiful Movement usable.

hook.text: For generations, the ideal female body was thin. Then athletes and influencers challenged the standard.

buildup.text: Social media amplified women showing strength feats: deadlifts, pull-ups, Olympic lifts. Strength became aspirational.

discovery.text: Research confirmed that focusing on performance over appearance improves body image and exercise adherence.

twist.text: The movement created its own pressures. Some women felt they had to be strong and lean â€” another unrealistic standard.

climax.text: The healthiest shift is valuing what bodies can do, not just how they look. Function over form.

punchline.text: Strong replaced thin. But the real goal is capable â€” in any body.

quiz.question: What improves both body image and exercise adherence?
options: Focusing on performance goals rather than appearance
